reviews.text: I have just got back after spending new years eve and a week at this hotel. I am depressed to be home! The weather wasn't brill, but I wasn't expecting it to be. Travelled with my mum and my 8yr old daughter and had a super time. The rooms are old - but clean. Food was average, plenty of choice. Hotel itself is a bit tired, could do with a touch up in some places, but the Tunisian people were so so so lovely! They made my holiday. Please be careful if you have teenage daughters though, cos they will fall for the charm of the animation team and not realise it is all a front. I spoke to a lot of them and made some good friends, but they did tell me that they each had about 40 english girlfriends and it was a competition between them. They get the girls to fall in love with them and send them stuff from England, then once the girls have left they wait for the new coach load to arrive. Cheeky sleaze bags! But still, if you can see past that they are all gorgeous very hard working people, their lovely smiling faces made my holiday. The marina its self was very pleasant, have your wits about you though, the shop keepers don't like the word no! The New Years Eve gala meal was absolutely fantastic, a really enjoyable night. They treated myself, my mother and daughter like royalty for the whole week. Please try to ignore the negative comments about this place, some people are just miserable and are born moaners. If you want egg and chips-stay at home .........do you get what i'm trying to say!!! some people are never satisfied. Loved this hotel,and staff, especially Helmi-my husband!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely hotel. Deffinatly only 4 star though not any higher.
reviews.title: Nice hotel wrong time of year for us

likes.liked: — Massage and spa treatments were cheap and good value. English tv movie chanel

reviews.title: Loved the Hotel
reviews.text: 2nd time we have travelled to Tunisia. Port El Kantaoui is deffinatly more built up than Hammamet where we stayed last time. If you want more shopping and a busy atmosphere P E K is better, but if you want more traditional Tunisia Hammamet and down that end would be better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel allegro was quite big, and had a lovely big pool. Only problem was it was absolutly freezing at this time of year so no-one went in it! Overall the weather was quite cool. It was sunny but there was a cool breeze coming from the Sahara. Only the hard-core sun-bathers laid out on sun loungers, everyone else was too cold. Was a bit like English spring weather.
reviews.title: 2 star!

reviews.text: Food was ok, edible but not very exciting. Very much the same things every night.
reviews.title: hot and sweaty
nice hotel shame about the place.........
reviews.text: This was my first visit to Tunisia - and probably my last.
I travelled alone, although i was meeting my neighbours out there who had already been there a week.
reviews.title: party of 9, various ages - all say fantastic!

reviews.text: the Tunisian airline was disgusting to say the least, then I had the interogation from hell in arrivals, questioning why I was travelling as a lone female (I'd recently lost my husband) really making me feel uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Amazing First Holiday Abroad

likes.liked: — It Was So Close To The Beach

reviews.text: The hotel itself was palatial, comfortable and spotlessly clean, I had a room on the same floor as my friends although on booking we had been allocated rooms together.
reviews.title: Great value for money - staff excellent - will return

likes.liked: — relaxed atmosphere, helpfulness of the staff, entertainment team were amusing
likes.disliked: — Rooms a little shabby and dated

reviews.text: The food although varied and tasty, got a bit boring after a while, but was always edible and there was always salads.
reviews.title: Fantastic, relaxing, hot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a weeks package holiday at this hotel and want to be back there!
reviews.title: Great All inclusive hotel

likes.disliked: — Opening hours and form filling in

reviews.text: Arrival:
reviews.title: Well worth every penny!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They did not inform you on the airline that you have to complete a form to present with your passport. Once in the terminal building it was so busy that you could not see any forms, you just had to fight your way through to get one!
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it

likes.liked: — Pool area and events run by animation team

reviews.title: Brilliant!!
reviews.text: It was around a 30min transfer from Monastir airport to the hotel.

When checking in, another form had to be completed, then we were first told our room was not ready and then another staff member told us it was! Anyway, after being issued with our green wristband, we dumped our bags and went down for lunch.
reviews.title: Just got back today..........!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently returned from an AI week at the Hotel Riviera and we had a thoroughly good holiday. Please, please take the negative reviews with a pinch of salt... yes the rooms are slightly dated, but who the hell in their right mind spends any length of time (apart from sleeping and the beds are comfortable) in their hotel room! This seems to be the common theme of the negative reviews.
reviews.title: Take the negative reviews with pinch of salt - we had great time.

likes.liked: — The pool area and the activities. Also the weather!
likes.disliked: — Having to barter all the time - got a bit annoying after a while.

reviews.text: Now onto the holiday...we arrived at the Riviera after a 40-minute taxi journey form Monistir Airport (we didn't have transfers) and were sorted out with our rooms. We stayed in room 457, which was ideal as it was on the top floor with great views. However, due to the layout of the hotel, it seemed impossible not to get a great view as all the rooms overlooked the pool or lovely gardens/seating area. The view from our room was pretty impressive and provided an excellent photo opportunity. Even though the hotel is a short walk away from the beach, you could get an excellent view from the balcony (which every room had).
reviews.title: Dark and Disappointing

reviews.text: There is a great mix of nationalities at the hotel, which I felt contributed to the holiday experience. People from everywhere from Russia to the UK to Algeria!
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is also a pleasant surprise as; before we flew out we could find any pictures of the beach on the net. We therefore concluded that it couldn't have been up to much! But it's lovely powdery light coloured sand, very nice to walk along. My only criticism is that is rather busy and a little untidy, but putting this into perspective, it was the middle of August - i.e. High Season! It was also the Jellyfish time and this made it hazardous to enter the water. But that didn't really bother me either.
reviews.title: Keep few steps ahead

reviews.text: There seemed to be lots of interesting trips on offer to all over Tunisia. I am usually the type of person who likes to explore and see what the country has to offer but on this holiday we just relaxed most of the time. The only trip we took was to the water park, which to be honest wasn't up to much! Unless you've never been to a (good) water park before and have no expectations at all, then don't go. There are 4 slides, a rubber ring pool and a wave pool. You could spend a morning there (like we did) and that's about it.
reviews.title: Great hotel

likes.liked: — The staff and the standing of service
